div.p: Permit me to express to you my condolence under the severe bereavement which has befallen you and your family in the loss of your beloved son. Death is ever sad - but never so much so as when it removes from the ties of parents a child - to sleep on the shores of a distant land. A thousand feelings overwhelm the father with grief as he thinks his son may have wanted his parental skill and consolation - a thousand times he is inclined again to think that son will yet return - for the death of those who are far from

us cannot be fully realized. The fond impulses of affection contend with the fact and almost at times discard it - until years have rolled by and sealed the truth on the grief-worn heart of the bereaved mourner - a truth forever

It was my misfortune to lose a fond mother while absent from home at school. The sorrow which weighed upon my heart was beyond expression. It lay like a heavy dream upon my life. Home to me was lost forever - still my mother did not seem entirely dead and gone forever. So it is that our heart in fond affection cherished for long years of hope and love was with the destroyer of death.
My Dear Doctor, accept my heart-felt condolence with
your grief and the sorrow of your afflicted family. May Heaven, smile upon those who remain, and protect them and you through a long and prosperous life.

Your son, just stepping into the fold of life, in the dignity of manly and generous integrity is a loss that no time can replace. Though others may grow up around you he will ever be missed from the circle. There is no consolation for the father, except that high faith in Him who guides and directs all for a grander and happier existence where grief, & care shall abide no more.
With every wish for your health and that of your family.
